intro: Hieracium segurae, commonly known as Segura's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets and is often found in low-altitude regions. Hieracium segurae is a perennial species with hairy stems and basal leaves, adapted to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
